definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: But he has one problem -- a hot temper.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他有一个问题，那就是脾气太急燥。

sentences.english: He tried to tick me off, once; and I lost my temper.
sentences.chinese: 有一次他想叱责我，我发了脾气。

sentences.english: Tom is a short fuse, he has bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个急性子，脾气不好。

sentences.english: He had cleared off his ill-humour at Randalls.
sentences.chinese: 他已经在兰得尔清除了他的坏脾气。

sentences.english: I'm sorry to be so short-tempered but I have an awful headache.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉脾气这么坏，所有是我头疼得要命。

sentences.english: There are few men in this world who get mad at graceful women.
sentences.chinese: 这个世上恐怕很少有男人会对闲雅的女人发脾气。

sentences.english: Some bad-tempered members shouted at the chairman during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 一些坏脾气的会员在会议期间向主席叫喊。

sentences.english: My brother is ill-tempered, and always stirs up trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我弟弟的脾气很暴躁，常惹是生非。

sentences.english: But bilious outbursts and business success often go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 但坏脾气往往与商业上的成功并肩而行。

sentences.english: The rhino, which is almost extinct, with its extraordinary horns and bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 犀牛，几乎灭绝的物种，有着神奇的犀角和暴脾气。

sentences.english: He immediately got angry and squawked at her.
sentences.chinese: 公鹌鹑立刻大发脾气并朝母鹌鹑大叫起来。

sentences.english: When parents and children are temperamental opposites, the results can be explosive.
sentences.chinese: 当家长与孩子们脾气相反时，其结果可能是爆炸性的。

sentences.english: Dad, I since the childhood to you are filled with hate, I hate you the flip-side of bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸我从小对你充满怨恨，我讨厌你那暴躁的坏脾气。

sentences.english: Mr Jobs has shared his spleen around over the years.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯的坏脾气年头已经不小。

sentences.english: The child was furious and flung itself about the room .
sentences.chinese: 那小孩子大发脾气，在房间里冲来冲去。

definition: to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
